Angular Essentials


Files Present While creating a Project

tsconfig.app.json, tsconfig.json, tsconfig.spec.json - These are typescript configuration files don't change until you know what you are doing. These configurations helps to change typescript code to JS code while rendering in UI.

package.json - dependencies going to be used in the project will be there.

angular.json - provided by cli for angular configurations don't change unless you know to change.

src - Where we type our code for the project.

src/app - Important folder where we create components, etc to use.

style.css - Used to set global styles.

index.html - Loads first when the website of the project is visited.

main.ts - First code executed while visiting the website.

assets folder - To store images to be used in the project.

If all the dependencies mentioned in package.json is not installed run the following command inside project folder.

  1. npm install


How Does the Angular shoes initial page.

  1. The index.html is first loaded UI page where here will be a mention of component <app-root>.
  2. The first executable code will be written in main.js where we import AppComponent which will available under the src folder.
  3. Inside the app component there will be a decorator @component({}) which will contains information of the component

    3.1 Selector will have the name which should be used in html to display this component in this case its app-root.

    3.2 Template (HTML) to be used by the component will be mentioned in templateUrl with path.

    3.3 CSS to be used for the component will be mentioned under styleUrl with path - These styles will be applied only to                this component.
